verb.description: Move or cause to move rapidly around and around.
examples: leaves whirled in eddies of wind
I whirled her around the dance floor

noun.description: A rapid movement around and around.

phrases: I popped it in the CD-ROM drive to give it a whirl.
The best way to truly understand it is to give it a whirl.
So break out the mixing bowls and give these recipes a whirl.
Mandy told me she was participating because my friend told me he was doing it, it sounded like fun, and so I decided to give it a whirl.
Then in 2001 I heard about blogging and thought I'd give it a whirl.
origin: Middle English: the verb probably from Old Norse hvirfla turn about; the noun partly from Middle Low German, Middle Dutch wervel spindle, or from Old Norse hvirfill circle, from a Germanic base meaning rotate.
